Home Loans and What You May Not Know

The first and most practical mortgage advise you can get is to learn the workings of mortgages before choosing lenders and mortgage packages.

One of the first things lenders will look at when you are applying for a http://trustdeedinvestings.com/equity-investing/home-loan/ is your debt to income ratio. This attribute will affect your range of options when it comes to what sort of home you can purchase. Home loan calculaters are also useful in giving you an idea of what lenders are looking for.

Lenders will also want to look at your front and back end ratios. You can calculate for these figures using your gross income. Gross income means income before being taxed. Your front end ratio is what the lenders decide you can afford in payments. For conventional loans the front end ratio is equivalent to 33% of the gross income while for FHA loans it would be 31%. Mortgage payments, car payments, credit card bills and other recurring payments or debts represent the back end ratio. For an FHA loan the back end ratio is 43% and 45% for conventional loans.

This means that when you are looking at your options for a http://investmenttrustdeed.wordpress.com/2011/09/23/just-a-few-details-regarding-home-loans/ , you should also take into account your other recurring expenses such as credit card bills and car payments.

You should also know the difference between being pre-approved and pre-qualified for a mortgage. The type of home you will be able to purchase will also be affected by this detail.

If you are already pre-qualified then that means the lenders have already decided that you are qualified for some loans. This is based entirely on a lender’s point of view.

Being pre-approved on the other hand means that the lender has already verified finances, credit ratings and bank references. A pre-approval letter may be issued and having this letter will signify to sellers that you are really serious about purchasing.

When it comes to a home loan, being pre-approved gives more advantages than being simply pre-qualified. You will have more options when shopping for a new home if you already carry a pre-approval letter. You can close deals faster as well.
